div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:

FHIR Implementation Guide for the PROTECT-CHILD project, defining a common pediatric transplant data model (recipient, donor, transplant events, follow-up, labs, microbiology, biospecimens, omics and outcomes) for use in local data space capsules and federated analytics.

title.value: PROTECT-CHILD Pediatric Transplant Data Implementation Guide

description.value: FHIR Implementation Guide for the PROTECT-CHILD project, defining a common pediatric transplant data model (recipient, donor, transplant events, follow-up, labs, microbiology, biospecimens, omics and outcomes) for use in local data space capsules and federated analytics.

valueMarkdown.value: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

description.value: adenovirus_igg – presence of IgG antibodies to adenovirus; false=Negative, true=Positive.
adenovirus_igm – presence of IgM antibodies to adenovirus; false=Negative, true=Positive.
Anti-endothelial cell antibodies or other non-HLA antibodies not captured above.
Age (in years) of the subject at the time of DNA extraction.
Name and version of the alignment tool.
Allele frequency for the variant.
Variant allele sequence (e.g., C).
Database used for this variant annotation.
Information about the databases used for annotation.
Information about the tool used for annotation.
Anti-MICA (MHC class I–related chain A) antibody result.
Anti-MICB (MHC class I–related chain B) antibody result.
antihypertensive_treatment – blood-pressure–lowering drug(s) used pre-transplant.
antiviral_phrophylaxis – preventive antiviral medication(s) given to reduce risk of viral infection or reactivation (Kidney only).
Date when the array was run.
Angiotensin II type-1 receptor (AT1R) antibody result.
Beta value representing methylation level.
Biological sample linked to transplant patients and omics studies, aligned with the bio_sample table.
Reference to the primary biosample collected at this visit (bio_sample_id).
Tissue types for biological samples (from the bio_sample table).
Allowed tissue types for BioSample.tissue_type.
Date of bisulfite conversion.
Bisulfite conversion kit used in the epigenome experiment.
bkv_fish_kidney_biopsy – BK virus FISH on kidney biopsy; false=Negative, true=Positive.
bkv_dna_kidney_biopsy – detection of BK virus DNA on kidney biopsy; false=Negative, true=Positive.
blood_bkv_dna – detection of BK virus DNA in blood; false=Negative, true=Positive.
cmv_dna – CMV nucleic acid test result (false=Negative, true=Positive).
ebv_dna – EBV nucleic acid test result (quantitative, float).
parvovirus_b19_dna – detection of parvovirus B19 DNA in blood; false=Negative, true=Positive.
Type of chip used for the epigenome array.
Coordinate system for numbering the chromosomes.
Chromosome identifier (e.g. 1–22, 23=X, 24=Y, 25=MT).
Clinical variables and vital signs recorded for a transplant patient.
Reference to clinical variable/vital signs information associated with this outcome.
Reference to clinical variables recorded at this visit (clinical_variable_id).
cmv_igg – presence of IgG antibodies against CMV; false=Negative, true=Positive.
cmv_igm – presence of IgM antibodies against CMV; false=Negative, true=Positive.
Locus information for CNV.
Cold ischaemia time for the graft in minutes (cold_ischemia_time).
Relevant concomitant diseases associated to a subject or record.
Categories of relevant concomitant diseases.
ValueSet of relevant concomitant diseases.
Reference to the concomitant disease record associated with this episode.
Set of relevant concomitant diseases.
Clinical episode related to a concomitant disease for a transplant patient.
Reference to the concomitant episode this medication belongs to.
Reference to concomitant episode information associated with this outcome.
Reference to a concomitant episode associated with this visit (concomitant_episode_id).
Concomitant medication records associated with a concomitant episode.
Categories of concomitant medications.
ValueSet of concomitant medication categories.
Copy number value for CNV data.
Date when vital signs were measured.
Date of histological diagnosis.
Date on which the instrumental investigation was performed.
Date at which liver disease was diagnosed.
Date at which renal disease was diagnosed.
dbSNP reference ID (rsID) maintained by NCBI.
Detection p-value for the methylation measurement.
Diastolic blood pressure in mmHg.
dna_concentration – DNA concentration for the sample (float).
ABO blood group of the donor.

name.value: Donor allograft HLA Class I loci

description.value: Donor HLA Class I loci relevant for the transplant (HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-C).

name.value: Donor allograft HLA Class II loci

description.value: Donor HLA Class II loci relevant for the transplant (HLA-DR, HLA-DP, HLA-DQ).
donor_id – reference to the donor associated with this microbiology record.
Whether the donor liver graft is complete or partial.
Type of liver donation (complete vs partial).
Allowed values for donor liver type (Complete, Partial).
Type of dialysis the donor received before kidney transplantation.
Dialysis type used for the donor prior to kidney transplantation.
Allowed dialysis types for donor prior to kidney transplant.
Rh factor of the donor.
Donor-specific antibody flag for the HLA antibody above (yes/no).
Ratio of donor graft weight to recipient body weight (d_r_weight_ration).
dose – maintenance dose of the immunosuppressant.
Unit for the selected immunosuppressant dose.
ebv_igg_anti_vca – presence of IgG antibodies against EBV Viral Capsid Antigen (VCA); false=Negative, true=Positive.
ebv_igg_ebna – presence of IgG antibodies against EBV Nuclear Antigen (EBNA); false=Negative, true=Positive.
ebv_igm_anti_ea – presence of IgM antibodies against EBV Early Antigen (EA); false=Negative, true=Positive.
ebv_igm_anti_vca – presence of IgM antibodies against EBV Viral Capsid Antigen (VCA); false=Negative, true=Positive.
Date when this maintenance immunosuppressant regimen was stopped (if applicable).
End position of the target region (genomic coordinate).
Epigenome (e.g. methylation array) study metadata and platform details.
epigenome_study_id – reference to epigenome study linked to this sample.
Date of the concomitant episode.
Description of the concomitant episode.
Endothelin receptor type-A (ETAR) antibody result.
Free-text description of the post-transplant event.
Date when the post-transplant event resolved or ended.
Date when the post-transplant event started.
Example biological sample used in Visit example.
Example set of clinical variables for a transplant patient.
Example record of a concomitant disease.

Example record of immunosuppressive induction therapy given to a patient.
Example record of maintenance immunosuppressive therapy for a transplant recipient.
Example imaging/instrumental investigation for a transplant patient.
Example creatinine result for a transplant recipient.
Example definition of a lab test (Albumin).
Example lab report grouping a single creatinine result.
Example immune function marker record for a transplant patient.
Example methylomic record for a locus.
Example microbiology panel for a transplant recipient.
Example outcome record for a transplant patient.
Example outcome type: Chronic renal failure after pLTx.
Example of a patient instrumental investigation linked to InstrumentalInvestigation catalogue.
Example post-transplant event type: Episodes of AKI after LTx.
Example of a post-transplant event (e.g., infection episode).
Example record of pre-transplant medications.
Example GRCh38 reference genome used for genomic tests.
Example target region linked to a genomic test.
Example transplant instance mapped from the transplant table.
Example donor instance mapped from the donor table.
Example recipient instance mapped from the patient table.
Example annotation for a variant occurrence.
Example variant occurrence linked to a target region.
Example visit instance mapped from the visit table.
First warm ischaemia time for the graft in minutes (1_warm_ischemia_time).
Genomic position where a fusion variant occurs.
Supporting read count of the fusion.
Somatic or germline origin of the variant.
Definition of a genomic test / sequencing platform and pipeline configuration.
genomic_test_id – reference to the genomic test configuration used for this sample.
Reference to the genomic test used in this epigenome study.
Reference to the genomic test (platform) containing this target region.
Name of the platform using sequencing, assigned by the institution.
Version of the platform using sequencing, assigned by the institution.
Allele state.
Pulse rate in beats per minute.
Patient’s height/length in centimeters.
Gene ID based on HGNC nomenclature.
Gene symbol given by HGNC nomenclature.
Nomenclature for the sequence variant at the DNA level (HGVS c. notation).
Nomenclature for the sequence variant at the protein level (HGVS p. notation).
Class or locus of the HLA antibody being recorded.
hsv_igg – presence of IgG antibodies to HSV; false=Negative, true=Positive.
hsv_igm – presence of IgM antibodies to HSV; false=Negative, true=Positive.
Immunosuppressive drug definition used in initial or maintenance therapy.
Dose of the selected immunosuppressant used for induction.
ValueSet of immunosuppressive drug types.
Types of immunosuppressive drugs used in the transplant setting.
Reference to the immunosuppressant drug used for induction.
immunosuppressant_id – reference to the immunosuppressant drug used for maintenance.
ValueSet of units for immunosuppressant induction dose.
Units for immunosuppressant induction dose.
Record of immunosuppressive induction treatment given to a transplant patient.
Name/type of the immunosuppressant drug.
Reference to immunosuppressive induction treatment associated with this visit (imm_ind_pat_id).
Reference to immunosuppressive maintenance treatment associated with this visit (imm_main_pat_id).
Maintenance immunosuppressive therapy given to the transplant patient, aligned with the immunosuppressive_maintenance_patient table.

name.value: Immunosuppressive Maintenance to Patient Type CodeSystem

description.value: Type of immunosuppressive maintenance record.

name.value: Immunosuppressive Maintenance to Patient Type ValueSet

description.value: Allowed types for immunosuppressive maintenance records.
Catalogue of instrumental investigation tests, aligned with the instrumental_investigation table.
instrumental_investigation_id – reference to the catalogue entry describing the test performed.
Name of the instrumental investigation test conducted.
ValueSet of instrumental investigation tests conducted.
Types of instrumental investigation tests conducted.
Whether and which complications occurred during surgery (intraoperative_complications).
Intraoperative complications during liver transplantation.
Allowed intraoperative complications during liver transplantation.
Transplanted kidney side (kidney_side).
Side of the kidney for nephrectomy / transplant context.
Allowed values for kidney side.
Individual laboratory result for a transplant recipient, aligned with the lab_result table.
Reference to laboratory results associated with this visit (lab_result_id).
patient_id – reference to the transplant recipient for whom this lab result is recorded.
Units of measurement used for laboratory results, aligned with the lab_result unit conceptual domain.
Allowed units of measurement for lab result values (unit column).
Definition of a laboratory test, including its name and unit.
Reference to lab test definition associated with this outcome.
Name of the laboratory test conducted.
ValueSet of laboratory tests conducted.
Types of laboratory tests conducted.
lab_test_id – reference to the lab test definition (LabTest catalog row) associated with this lab result.
Laboratory report grouping one or more lab result observations for a transplant recipient.
Additional description or free-text for the liver disease diagnosis.
Primary liver disease diagnosis (coding system TBD; may map from OMOP or local codes).
M-value transformation of the beta value.
Manifest number for the array.
Markers of immune function including HLA and non-HLA antibodies for a transplant patient.
Mean target coverage.
Type of concomitant medication applied.
Medication(s) relevant to this variant annotation.
Number of reads showing methylation.
Methylomic study / locus-level methylation metrics.
methylomic_study_id – reference to methylomic study linked to this sample.
Median Fluorescence Intensity (MFI) for the HLA antibody listed in hla_antibody_class.
Microbiology results related to transplant recipients and/or donors, aligned with the microbiology table.
Reference to microbiology results associated with this outcome.
Reference to microbiology results associated with this visit (microbiology_id).
Whether the patient’s native kidney was surgically removed before the transplant (nephrectomy_original_kidney).
Specification of other types of complications during surgery (intraoperative_complications_other).
other_medications – any other relevant pre-transplant medications.
Outcome information for transplant patients, linked to multiple clinical domains.
Date associated with the outcome (e.g. assessment date).
Reference to the outcome record associated with this visit (outcome_id).
Definition of an outcome type used to categorize outcome records.
Reference to the type/category of outcome.
Name of the outcome type.
ValueSet of post-transplant outcome types.
Types of clinical outcomes after transplant.
Oxygen saturation at rest, in percent.
parvovirus_b19_dna_igg – presence of IgG antibodies to parvovirus B19; false=Negative, true=Positive.
parvovirus_b19_dna_igm – presence of IgM antibodies to parvovirus B19; false=Negative, true=Positive.
ABO blood group of the transplant recipient.
ABO blood groups for transplant recipients (maps from OMOP A/B/AB/0).
ABO blood groups for transplant recipients.
Recipient’s HLA Class I loci relevant for the transplant (HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-C).
Recipient’s HLA Class II loci relevant for the transplant (HLA-DR, HLA-DP, HLA-DQ).

description.value: Class I HLA loci relevant to transplant matching.

description.value: Allowed Class II HLA loci (HLA-DR, HLA-DP, HLA-DQ).
Reference to the patient for whom clinical variables are recorded.
Reference to the patient for whom the concomitant episode is recorded.
Reference to the patient receiving immunosuppressive induction.
Reference to the patient for whom the immune function markers are recorded.
patient_id – reference to the transplant recipient associated with this microbiology record.
Reference to the patient for whom the outcome is recorded.
patient_id – reference to the transplant recipient for whom the instrumental investigation was performed.
Reference to the patient who experienced the post-transplant event.
Instrumental investigation performed on a transplant patient, aligned with the patient_instrumental_investigation table.

Reference to a patient instrumental investigation associated with this visit (pat_inst_inv_id).
Result of the instrumental investigation test conducted (Normal / Abnormal).
Allowed results for the instrumental investigation test (Normal, Abnormal).
Most recent panel-reactive antibody (PRA) percentage prior to transplant.
Maximum panel-reactive antibody (PRA) percentage prior to transplant.
Rh factor of the transplant recipient.
Rh factor of the transplant recipient (maps from OMOP Positive/Negative).
Allowed Rh factor values for transplant recipients.
Percentage of selected bases covered at ≥100x.

Types of post-transplant events.
Reference to a post-transplant event (e.g. rejection episode) occurring at this visit (post_event_id).

Allowed antihypertensive drugs for antihypertensive_treatment.
Reference to pre-transplant medication information associated with this outcome.
Reference to pre-medication information associated with this visit (pre_medication_id).
patient_id – reference to the transplant recipient for whom the pre-medication is recorded.
Type of pre-transplant medication record.
Allowed type(s) for pre-medication records.
Pre-transplant medication record aligned with the pre_medication table.
Link or identifier to raw data files.
Total number of reads for this locus.
Information about the length of the read.
Information about the method of sequence reading.
patient_id – reference to the transplant recipient for whom maintenance therapy is recorded.
Reference allele sequence (e.g., A).
Reference genome definition used by genomic tests, including build_name and FASTA path.
Reference genome build names.
Allowed reference genome build names (GRCh38, GRCh37).
Filesystem or URI path of the reference genome FASTA file.
Reference to the reference genome used for this genomic test.
Reference to the reference genome used in this methylomic study.
Transcript ID based on a protein-coding RNA (mRNA), including accession and version number.
Additional description or free-text for the renal disease diagnosis.
Primary renal disease diagnosis (coding system TBD; may map from OMOP or local codes).
result – result of the instrumental investigation test conducted (Normal / Abnormal).
rituximab – any rituximab given pre-transplant.
Sample identifier used in the epigenome study.
send_ingemm_date – date when the sample was sent to INGEMM.
Type of sample used in the epigenome study (Blood, Saliva, Other tissues).
Date when the array was scanned.
Second warm ischaemia time for the graft in minutes (2_warm_ischemia_time, kidney only).
Sentrix array barcode.
Position on the Sentrix array.
Structural variant type.
Sequencer machine information.
Device used as SNP reader.
Date when this maintenance immunosuppressant regimen was started.
Start position of the target region (genomic coordinate).
Systolic blood pressure in mmHg.
Information about the capture method of examined and targeted region.
Identifier of the target disease for this epigenome study.
Target gene / genomic region associated with a genomic test platform.
Identifier of the target region for which methylation information is recorded.
Reference to the target region (gene/region) for which the variant information is recorded.
Body temperature in degrees Celsius.
Months between disease diagnosis and transplant date (time_diag_to_tx).
Encounter profile representing a transplant, linking the transplant recipient and donor and aligned with the transplant table.

High-level logical model summarising a pediatric transplant case in PROTECT-CHILD.
It connects the main clinical and data domains: - Recipient (PatientTransplant) - Donor (Donor) - Transplant encounter (Transplant) - Visits and follow-up - Concomitant diseases and medications - Immunosuppression - Clinical variables, labs, microbiology, instrumental investigations - Events and outcomes - Provenance / technical metadata
Donor profile based on the FHIR Patient resource, aligned with the donor table.
Reference to the donor associated with this transplant.
Reference to the transplant associated with this visit (transplant_id).
Transplant recipient profile based on the FHIR Patient resource, aligned with the patient table.
Type of solid-organ transplant (liver, kidney, combined liver-kidney).
Allowed transplant types.
Type of biliary reconstruction used (type_surgical_biliary_anastomosis).

name.value: Type of surgical biliary anastomosis CodeSystem

description.value: Types of biliary anastomosis used in liver transplantation.

name.value: Type of surgical biliary anastomosis ValueSet

description.value: Allowed types of biliary anastomosis in liver transplant.
unit_id – identifier of the dose unit (e.g. mg, mg/kg, etc.), aligned with unit_id column in the DM.
Reference to the unit definition associated with this lab test.
urine_bkv_dna – detection of BK virus DNA in urine; false=Negative, true=Positive.
Annotation of a variant occurrence using external databases and classifications.
Name and version of the variant calling tool.
Classification level for the variant.
Exon number in which the variant occurred.
Functional variant type.
Variant occurrence information within a target region.
Reference to the variant occurrence this annotation refers to.
Origin of the variant (e.g., inherited, de novo, somatic).
Pathogenicity assessment (e.g., pathogenic, likely pathogenic, VUS, benign).
Variant depth divided by read depth.
Tier level for the variant (e.g., Tier 1, Tier 2).
Presence of relevant arterial/venous anatomical variants (vascular_anomalies).
Whether there is a vessel size/configuration mismatch requiring tailoring (vessel_mismatch_d_r).
Encounter profile representing a visit in the transplant follow-up schedule, aligned with the visit table.
Type of visit in the transplant follow-up schedule.
Allowed types of visits in the transplant follow-up schedule.
vzv_igg – presence of IgG antibodies to varicella–zoster virus; false=Negative, true=Positive.
vzv_igm – presence of IgM antibodies to varicella–zoster virus; false=Negative, true=Positive.
Patient’s weight in kilograms.
